trial_identification.studytitle: Ultrasound and Doppler flow study of placental invasion of myometrium and its maternal and fetal effects
trial_identification.scientifictitle: In Pregnant women, the role of ultrasound and Doppler in prediction of placental invasion of myometrium and its relation to maternal and fetal outcome

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Fetal medicine and complications of pregnancy

interventions.interventions: ultrasound and Doppler measurement of myometrial thickness over the placenta done once at 37 weeks of gestation

primaryOutcome.outcome: accuracy of ultrasound and color Doppler in diagnosis of placenta accreta

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: pregnancy duration of 36 40 weeks. 230 of women had history of previous cesarean delivery or other uterine surgery and 50 are control cases
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: women with severe vaginal bleeding or suspected rupture uterus and hemodynamically unstable patients

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: 135 King Faisal street Haram Giza. kasr Alainy medical school. Cairo university.Post code 12151

secondarysponsor.sponsoraddress: 60 Fostat appartments, 1st neighberhood, Masr ElKadeema, Cairo, Egypt.postcode 16122

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Prospective observational study included 280 pregnant women candidate for elective cesarean section. Ultrasound and color doppler were done for all women . The primary outcome was accuracy of ultrasound and color Doppler in diagnosis of placenta accreta.Objective: to evaluate the efficiency of ultrasound and Doppler in prediction of placental invasion of myometrium and its effect on maternal and fetal outcome.
